byline.contributor: Saeed Al-Batati contributed reporting from Al Mukalla, Yemen; Mohammed Ali Kalfood from Sana, Yemen; and Matthew Rosenberg from Washington.
byline.original: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK and KAREEM FAHIM

abstract: Saudi Air campaign against Houthis in Yemen, gamble by country's new leader King Salman, has resulted in devastated infrastructure, collapsed state and an escalating humanitarian crisis; Houthis have advanced despite bombings, capturing presidential palace in southern port of Aden; widening civil conflict has strengthened Yemeni branch of Al Qaeda and risks destabilizing Saudi Arabia.
lead_paragraph: King Salman of Saudi Arabia bet his prestige as a new leader on rallying his Arab allies for a campaign to save Yemen from an Iranian takeover. The results showed just how large a risk they took.

headline.main: Saudi Leaders Have High Hopes for Yemen Airstrikes, but Houthi Attacks Continue
headline.print_headline: Saudi Prestige Suffers a Blow in Yemen Fight

snippet: King Salman of Saudi Arabia bet his prestige as a new leader on rallying his Arab allies for a campaign to save Yemen from an Iranian takeover. The results showed just how large a risk they took.

keywords.value: Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula
